#### Celltype assignemt

find conserved markger genes acrocces clusters.

```{r}
DefaultAssay(immune.combined) <- "RNA"

cluster0_conserved_markers <- FindConservedMarkers(immune.combined,
                              ident.1 = 0,
                              grouping.var = "timepoint",
                              only.pos = TRUE,min.pct = 0.25,  min.diff.pct = 0.25,
                      logfc.threshold = 0.25)

#Load the table with gene descriptions to help you identify to what cell types the genes in the cluster can correspond to
annotations <- read.csv("/home/projects/22102_single_cell/Day3/annotation.csv")

# Combine markers with gene descriptions 
cluster0_ann_markers <- cluster0_conserved_markers  |>  
                rownames_to_column(var="gene") |> 
                left_join(y = 
                            unique(
                              annotations[,c("gene_name", "description")]),
                          by = c("gene" = "gene_name"))

```

```{r}

immune.combined <- RenameIdents(object = immune.combined, 
                                "0" = "CD4+ T cells",
                                "1" = "CD8+ T cells",
                                "2" = "CD4+ T cells",
                                "3" = "NK cells",
                                "4" = "Monocyte",
                                "5" = "Monocyte",
                                "6" = "T reg",
                                "7" = "DC",
                                "8" = "B cells",
                                "9" = "Unknown",
                                "10" = "Platelet",
                                "11" = "Hematopoietic stem cells",
                                "12" = "Plasma Cells")

# Now, you can view the updated metadata
head(immune.combined@meta.data)
```

```{r}
# visualize data

immune.combined$cell_type_1 <- Idents(immune.combined)

DimPlot(immune.combined, reduction = 'umap', label = TRUE)
```
